nodes.name: DatasetStructured
nodes.description: This Node creates a DataFrame by reading data from HDFS, HIVE etc. The dataset was defined earlier in Fire by using the Dataset Feature. As a user, you just have to select the Dataset of your interest.

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: dataset
fields.title: Dataset
fields.description: Selected Dataset

nodes.name: PrintNRows
nodes.description: Prints the specified number of records in the DataFrame. It is useful for seeing intermediate output

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: n
fields.title: Num Rows to Print
fields.description: number of rows to be printed

fields.name: displayDataType
fields.title: Display Data Type
fields.description: If true display rows DataType

nodes.name: Split
nodes.description: This node splits the incoming DataFrame into 2. It takes in the fraction to use in splitting the data. For example, if the fraction is .7, it would split the data into 2 DataFrames, one containing 70% of the rows(passed from lower edge id to next node) and the other containing the remaining 30%(passed from higher edge id to next node).

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: fraction1
fields.title: Fraction 1
fields.description: Fraction to be used for Splitting the DataFrame into two. The first DataFrame would go to the lower edge output. The other would go to the higher edge output.

nodes.name: H2O Neural Network
nodes.description: H2O Deep Learning is based on a multi-layer feedforward artificial neural network that is trained with stochastic gradient descent using back-propagation.

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: isResponseIsCategorical
fields.title: isResponseColIsCategorical
fields.description: Specify a response column type(numeric or categorical). Separates the Classification and Regression

fields.name: labelCol
fields.title: Label Column
fields.description: Response variable column.

fields.name: ignoredCols
fields.title: Ignored Columns
fields.description: Features to be ignored for Modelling

fields.name: columnsToCategorical
fields.title: Columns to Categorical
fields.description: Columns to be Categorical encoded

fields.name: seed
fields.title: Seed
fields.description: Seed for pseudo random number generator (if applicable).

fields.name: balanceClasses
fields.title: Balance Classes
fields.description: Balance training data class counts via over/under-sampling (for imbalanced data).

fields.name: maxAfterBalanceSize
fields.title: Max After Balance Size
fields.description: Maximum relative size of the training data after balancing class counts (can be less than 1.0). Requires balance_classes.

fields.name: activation
fields.title: Activation
fields.description: Activation function.

fields.name: hidden
fields.title: Hidden
fields.description: Specify the hidden layer sizes (value must be positive)

fields.name: epochs
fields.title: Epochs
fields.description: SHow many times the dataset should be iterated (streamed), can be fractional.

fields.name: nfolds
fields.title: Number of Folds
fields.description: Number of folds for K-fold cross-validation (0 to disable or >= 2).

fields.name: trainSamplesPerIteration
fields.title: Train Samples Per Iteration
fields.description: Number of training samples (globally) per MapReduce iteration. Special values are 0: one epoch, -1: all available data (e.g., replicated training data), -2: automatic.

fields.name: targetRatioCommToComp
fields.title: Target ratio comm to comp
fields.description: Target ratio of communication overhead to computation. Only for multi-node operation and train_samples_per_iteration = -2 (auto-tuning).

fields.name: categoricalEncoding
fields.title: Categorical Encoding
fields.description: Specify one of the various encoding schemes for handling categorical features

fields.name: ignoreConstCols
fields.title: Ignore Const Columns
fields.description: Ignore constant columns.

fields.name: scoreEachIteration
fields.title: Score Each Iteration
fields.description: Whether to score during each iteration of model training.

fields.name: stoppingRounds
fields.title: Stopping Rounds
fields.description: Early stopping based on convergence of stopping_metric. Stop if simple moving average of length k of the stopping_metric does not improve for k:=stopping_rounds scoring events (0 to disable).

fields.name: maxRuntimeSecs
fields.title: Max Runtime Secs
fields.description: his argument specifies the maximum time that the AutoML process will run for. If both max_runtime_secs and max_models are specified, then the AutoML run will stop as soon as it hits either of these limits. If neither max_runtime_secs nor max_models are specified, then max_runtime_secs defaults to 3600 seconds (1 hour).

fields.name: stoppingMetric
fields.title: StoppingMetric
fields.description: Metric to use for early stopping (AUTO: logloss for classification, deviance for regression)

fields.name: stoppingTolerance
fields.title: StoppingTolerance
fields.description: Relative tolerance for metric-based stopping criterion (stop if relative improvement is not at least this much)

fields.name: standardize
fields.title: Standardize
fields.description: If enabled, automatically standardize the data. If disabled, the user must provide properly scaled input data.

fields.name: loss
fields.title: Loss
fields.description: SLoss function.

fields.name: adaptiveRate
fields.title: Adaptive Rate
fields.description: Adaptive learning rate.

fields.name: rho
fields.title: Rho
fields.description: Adaptive learning rate time decay factor (similarity to prior updates).

fields.name: epsilon
fields.title: Epsilon
fields.description: Adaptive learning rate smoothing factor (to avoid divisions by zero and allow progress).

fields.name: rate
fields.title: Rate
fields.description: Learning rate (higher => less stable, lower => slower convergence).

fields.name: rateAnnealing
fields.title: Rate Annealing
fields.description: Learning rate annealing: rate / (1 + rate_annealing * samples).

fields.name: rateDecay
fields.title: Rate Decay
fields.description: Learning rate decay factor between layers (N-th layer: rate * rate_decay ^ (n - 1)

fields.name: momentumStart
fields.title: Momentum Start
fields.description: Specify the initial momentum at the beginning of training; we suggest 0.5 (Applicable only if adaptive_rate is disabled)

fields.name: momentumRamp
fields.title: Momentum Ramp
fields.description: Number of training samples for which momentum increases.

fields.name: momentumStable
fields.title: Momentum Stable
fields.description: Final momentum after the ramp is over (try 0.99).

fields.name: nesterovAcceleratedGradient
fields.title: Nesterov Accelerated Gradient
fields.description: Use Nesterov accelerated gradient (recommended).

fields.name: inputDropoutRatio
fields.title: Hidden Dropout Ratios
fields.description: Hidden layer dropout ratios (can improve generalization), specify one value per hidden layer, defaults to 0.5.

fields.name: inputDropoutRatio
fields.title: Hidden Dropout Ratios
fields.description: Hidden layer dropout ratios (can improve generalization), specify one value per hidden layer, defaults to 0.5.

fields.name: l1
fields.title: L1
fields.description: L1 regularization (can add stability and improve generalization, causes many weights to become 0).

fields.name: l2
fields.title: L2
fields.description: L2 regularization (can add stability and improve generalization, causes many weights to be small.

fields.name: maxW2
fields.title: Max W2
fields.description: Constraint for squared sum of incoming weights per unit (e.g. for Rectifier).

fields.name: initialWeightDistribution
fields.title: Initial Weight Distribution
fields.description: Initial weight distribution.

fields.name: initialWeightScale
fields.title: Initial Weight Scale
fields.description: Uniform: -value...value, Normal: stddev.

fields.name: scoreInterval
fields.title: Score interval
fields.description: Shortest time interval (in seconds) between model scoring.

fields.name: scoreTrainingSamples
fields.title: Score Training Samples
fields.description: Number of training set samples for scoring (0 for all).

fields.name: scoreValidationSamples
fields.title: Score Validation Samples
fields.description: Number of validation set samples for scoring (0 for all).

fields.name: scoreDutyCycle
fields.title: Score Duty Cycle
fields.description: Maximum duty cycle fraction for scoring (lower: more training, higher: more scoring).

fields.name: classificationStop
fields.title: Classification Stop
fields.description: Stopping criterion for classification error fraction on training data (-1 to disable).

fields.name: regressionStop
fields.title: Regression Stop
fields.description: Stopping criterion for regression error (MSE) on training data (-1 to disable).

fields.name: quietMode
fields.title: Quiet mode
fields.description: Enable quiet mode for less output to standard output.

fields.name: scoreValidationSampling
fields.title: Score Validation Sampling
fields.description: Method used to sample validation dataset for scoring.

fields.name: overwriteWithBestModel
fields.title: Overwrite With Best Model
fields.description: If enabled, override the final model with the best model found during training.

fields.name: useAllFactorLevels
fields.title: Use All Factor Levels
fields.description: Use all factor levels of categorical variables. Otherwise, the first factor level is omitted (without loss of accuracy). Useful for variable importances and auto-enabled for autoencoder.

fields.name: diagnostics
fields.title: Diagnostics
fields.description: Enable diagnostics for hidden layers.

fields.name: calculateFeatureImportances
fields.title: Calculate Feature Importances
fields.description: Compute variable importances for input features (Gedeon method) - can be slow for large networks.

fields.name: fastMode
fields.title: Fast Mode
fields.description: SEnable fast mode (minor approximation in back-propagation).

fields.name: forceLoadBalance
fields.title: Force Load Balance
fields.description: Force extra load balancing to increase training speed for small datasets (to keep all cores busy).

fields.name: replicateTrainingData
fields.title: Replicate Training Data
fields.description: Replicate the entire training dataset onto every node for faster training on small datasets.

fields.name: singleNodeMode
fields.title: Single Node Mode
fields.description: Run on a single node for fine-tuning of model parameters.

fields.name: shuffleTrainingData
fields.title: Shuffle Training Data
fields.description: Enable shuffling of training data (recommended if training data is replicated and train_samples_per_iteration is close to #nodes x #rows, of if using balance_classes).

fields.name: missingValuesHandling
fields.title: Missing Values Handling
fields.description: Handling of missing values. Either MeanImputation or Skip.

fields.name: sparse
fields.title: Sparse
fields.description: Sparse data handling (more efficient for data with lots of 0 values).

fields.name: averageActivation
fields.title: Average Activation
fields.description: Average activation for sparse auto-encoder. #Experimental.

fields.name: sparsityBeta
fields.title: Sparsity Beta
fields.description: Sparsity regularization. #Experimental.

fields.name: maxCategoricalFeatures
fields.title: Max Categorical Features
fields.description: Max. number of categorical features, enforced via hashing. #Experimental.

fields.name: reproducible
fields.title: Reproducible
fields.description: Force reproducibility on small data (will be slow - only uses 1 thread).

fields.name: exportWeightsAndBiases
fields.title: Export Weights And Biases
fields.description: Whether to export Neural Network weights and biases to H2O Frames.

fields.name: miniBatchSize
fields.title: Mini Batch Size
fields.description: SMini-batch size (smaller leads to better fit, larger can speed up and generalize better).

fields.name: elasticAveraging
fields.title: Elastic Averaging
fields.description: Elastic averaging between compute nodes can improve distributed model convergence. #Experimental.

fields.name: elasticAveragingMovingRate
fields.title: Elastic Averaging Moving Rate
fields.description: Elastic averaging moving rate (only if elastic averaging is enabled).

fields.name: elasticAveragingRegularization
fields.title: Elastic Averaging Regularization
fields.description: Elastic averaging regularization strength (only if elastic averaging is enabled).

fields.name: keepCrossValidationModels
fields.title: Keep Cross Validation Models
fields.description: Whether to keep the cross-validated models. Keeping cross-validation models may consume significantly more memory in the H2O cluster.

fields.name: keepCrossValidationPredictions
fields.title: Keep Cross Validation Predictions
fields.description: Whether to keep the predictions of the cross-validation predictions. This needs to be set to TRUE if running the same AutoML object for repeated runs because CV predictions are required to build additional Stacked Ensemble models in AutoML.

fields.name: keepCrossValidationFoldAssignment
fields.title: Keep Cross Validation Fold Assignment
fields.description: Whether to keep cross-validation assignments.

fields.name: distribution
fields.title: Distribution
fields.description: Distribution function.)

fields.name: tweediePower
fields.title: Tweedie Power
fields.description: Tweedie power for Tweedie regression, must be between 1 and 2.

fields.name: quantileAlpha
fields.title: Quantile Alhpa
fields.description: Desired quantile for Quantile regression, must be between 0 and 1.

fields.name: huberAlpha
fields.title: Huber Alpha
fields.description: Desired quantile for Huber/M-regression (threshold between quadratic and linear loss, must be between 0 and 1).

fields.name: weightCol
fields.title: Weight Column
fields.description: Column with observation weights. Giving some observation a weight of zero is equivalent to excluding it from the dataset; giving an observation a relative weight of 2 is equivalent to repeating that row twice. Negative weights are not allowed. Note: Weights are per-row observation weights and do not increase the size of the data frame. This is typically the number of times a row is repeated, but non-integer values are supported as well. During training, rows with higher weights matter more, due to the larger loss function pre-factor. If you set weight = 0 for a row, the returned prediction frame at that row is zero and this is incorrect. To get an accurate prediction, remove all rows with weight == 0.

fields.name: offsetCol
fields.title: Offset Column
fields.description: Offset column. This will be added to the combination of columns before applying the link function.

fields.name: foldCol
fields.title: Fold Column
fields.description: Column with cross-validation fold index assignment per observation.

fields.name: foldAssignment
fields.title: Fold Assignment
fields.description: Cross-validation fold assignment scheme, if fold_column is not specified. The 'Stratified' option will stratify the folds based on the response variable, for classification problems.

fields.name: aucType
fields.title: AUC Type
fields.description: Set default multinomial AUC type.

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: isTestData
fields.title: is Test Data
fields.description: To enable the test metrics.

fields.name: withContribution
fields.title: Compute Shapley Values
fields.description: Compute Shapley Values and it supported for Regression and Binomial Classification problem.

fields.name: path
fields.title: Path
fields.description: Path to save the Shapley contributions for test dataset.

fields.name: modelType
fields.title: Model Type
fields.description: Select the type of the model.

nodes.name: Select Columns
nodes.description: This node creates a new DataFrame that contains only the selected columns

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: outputCols
fields.title: Columns
fields.description: Columns to be included in the output DataFrame
